intro: Guatteria australis var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically smooth and glossy. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by dark, fleshy berries. This plant is often found in humid, shaded environments within lowland rainforests.
